intro: Thymophylla gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Thymophylla gnaphaloides is also known for its drought tolerance and ability to withstand coastal conditions.
